body.p: In the Board’s view, the control approach focuses more on the aim described in paragraph BC5.26(a) and the risks-and-rewards approach focuses more on the aim described in paragraph BC5.26(b). If an entity transfers an entire asset or an entire liability and retains no exposure to that asset or liability, the control approach and the risks-and-rewards approach both lead to the same outcome. Moreover, in such cases, achieving both aims described in paragraph BC5.26 is straightforward.
